title: LD_LIBRARY_PATH reset before `gcc` wrapper causes compiler error

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I have a module-installed system compiler, gcc-10.3, that was installed with some non-normal `.so` paths, particularly `--with-isl=/opt/crc/i/isl/0.18/gcc/4.8.5`. The system's `gcc/10.3.0` module adds `/opt/crc/i/isl/0.18/gcc/4.8.5/lib` to my `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` and everything works fine normally.

I have added this module to my `compilers.yaml` for `gcc@10.3`.

When I try and use this compiler to build spack packages, the `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` is being corrupted sometime before the call to `exec "${full_command[@]}"` in `spack/env/gcc/gcc`, where spack has inserted `:1:` between all of the paths. This causes my `gcc-10.3` to fail to run during package `./configure` due to the missing `libisl.so` path.

I fixed this by modifying my local `spack/env/gcc/gcc` wrapper to force-reset the paths before launching `full_command`, i.e, 

```
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/opt/crc/i/isl/0.18/gcc/4.8.5/lib:/opt/crc/g/gdb/10.1/gcc/10.3/lib:/opt/crc/g/gcc/10.3.0/lib64:/opt/crc/g/gcc/10.3.0/lib:/opt/crc/v/vtk/8.2.0/gcc/4.8.5/lib64:/opt/crc/p/python/2.7.15/gcc/lib 
exec "${full_command[@]}"
```

This solves the issue locally as long as we're using the `gcc/10.3.0` module. I haven't been able to figure out where the path modification is actually happening. The corrupted library path is:

```
/opt/crc/i/isl/0.18/gcc/4.8.5/lib:1:/opt/crc/g/gdb/10.1/gcc/10.3/lib:1:/opt/crc/g/gcc/10.3.0/lib64:1:/opt/crc/g/gcc/10.3.0/lib:1:/opt/crc/v/vtk/8.2.0/gcc/4.8.5/lib64:1:/opt/crc/p/python/2.7.15/gcc/lib
```

It's difficult for me to use a spack-installed compiler because the filesystem I'm using isn't mounted on the compute nodes. I'm trying to add some tools only for use on the head node at the moment.
